div.head: CHAP. XXVI.
1 Iob reprouing the vncharitable spirit of Bildad, 5 acknowledgeth the power of God to be infinite and vnsearchable.
div.ab: Howe hast thou helped him that is without power? how sauest thou the arme that hath no strength?
How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisedome? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing, as it is?
To whom hast thou vttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
Dead things are formed from vnder the waters, and the inhabitants thereof. Or, with the inhabitants.
Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no couering. Pro.15.11
He stretcheth out the North ouer the emptie place, and hangeth the earth vpon nothing.
Hee bindeth vp the waters in his thicke clouds, and the cloud is not rent vnder them.
Hee holdeth backe the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud vpon it.
Hee hath compassed the waters with bounds, vntill the day and night come to an end. Heb. vntill the end of light with darknesse.
The pillars of heauen tremble, and are astonished at his reproofe.
Hee diuideth the sea with his power, and by his vnderstanding he smiteth through the proud. Heb. pride.
By his spirit he hath garnished the heauens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
Loe, these are parts of his waies, but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can vnderstand?
